Reference

Defining your model

Parameter estimation and dose recommendation needs a model. The methods below allow you to construct a model using nlmixr, RxODE, deSolve or algebraic equations.

algebraic()

Use an external function to generate an algebraic model, capable of being used with tdmore() Algebraic functions are assumed to be dose-linear, meaning that they can be calculated for a single dose and then summed up for multiple doses.

pk1cptivbolusVCL()

A tdmore model to predict concentration in a 1cpt PK model with bolus administration

pk1cptoralbolusVCL()

A tdmore model to predict concentration in a 1cpt PK model with bolus administration

tdmore()

tdmore is a generic function to append TDM functionality to a pharmacometrics model.

tdmore(<algebraic>)

Build a tdmore object based on an algebraic model

tdmore(<default>)

Default function, catching unsupported types of models

tdmore(<nlmixrUI>)

Create a TDM-capable model from an nlmixr UI object.

tdmore(<RxODE>)

Create a TDM-capable model from an RxODE model

tdmore_deSolve()

Create a TDM-capable model from a deSolve model

errorModel()

Instantiate a new error model.

print(<tdmore>)

Print a tdmore object.

summary(<tdmore>)

Summarise a tdmore object.

formula(<tdmore>)

Get a formula that describes this model

Simulating from the model

TDMore offers a single unifying interface to simulate from a model.

predict(<tdmore>)

Predict from a tdmore model

model.frame(<tdmore>)

Get the specified data values, with the upper and lower bounds provided by the residual error model

residuals(<tdmore>)

Get the residual values of a predicted value vs the observed value This is based on the log-likelihood of the observed value in the residual error model

Estimating individual parameters

Use this simple command to estimate individual parameters. This results in a tdmorefit object. You can also define your own tdmorefit object with fixed parameter estimates.

estimate()

Calculate the Empirical Bayesian Estimate parameters that predict a given dataset using the model

tdmorefit()

Create a tdmorefit object manually

fitted(<tdmorefit>)

Get the predicted (fitted) data

formula(<tdmorefit>)

Get the model used to provide this fit

logLik(<tdmorefit>)

Get the log-likelihood of the predicted values.

model.frame(<tdmorefit>)

Get the observed values used to provide this model fit.

predict(<tdmorefit>)

Predict new data using the current model

print(<tdmorefit>)

Print an EBE fit.

summary(<tdmorefit>)

Summary of a tdmorefit object.

coef(<tdmorefit>)

The obtained parameter values for the fit

vcov(<tdmorefit>)

The variance-covariance matrix

confint(<tdmorefit>)

Calculates the confidence interval on the obtained parameter values

Investigate the log-likelihood profile

Get more information about the log-likelihood profile, how it looks like, and why a certain parameter set was estimated.

profile(<tdmorefit>)

Get an overview of the log-likelihood for varying parameter values. If arguments `fix` and `limits` are not set for a specific parameter, individual eta's will be generated to cover 95 percent of the population distribution.

getLikelihoodFun()

Get the right likelihood function for the specified type.

ll()

Calculate the log likelihood as the sum of the population likelihood and the prediction likelihood.

pop_ll()

Calculate the population log likelihood.

pred_ll()

Calculate the prediction log likelihood.

Plotting

We offer many plotting functions, all based on ggplot2. We suggest you build a ggplot object using ggplot.tdmorefit(), allowing you to do things like ggplot(myFit) + stat_predict().

algebraic()

Use an external function to generate an algebraic model, capable of being used with tdmore() Algebraic functions are assumed to be dose-linear, meaning that they can be calculated for a single dose and then summed up for multiple doses.

autoplot(<tdmore>)

Plot a tdmore object (typical profile (population) + between subject variability).

autoplot(<tdmorefit>)

Plot a tdmorefit object.

coef(<recommendation>)

The obtained parameter values for a recommendation.

coef(<tdmore>)

Get the population typical value parameters. This is a numeric vector of 0's, with the appropriate names.

coef(<tdmorefit>)

The obtained parameter values for the fit

computeTmax()

Compute the TMax value based on the specified regimen and observed data.

confint(<tdmorefit>)

Calculates the confidence interval on the obtained parameter values

default_model

Default example model TODO: Better documentation required

discrete.searchspace()

Add discrete options to a search space

errorModel()

Instantiate a new error model.

estimate()

Calculate the Empirical Bayesian Estimate parameters that predict a given dataset using the model

estimateMixtureModel()

Calculate the Empirical Bayesian Estimate parameters that predict a given dataset using a mixture model.

evaluate()

Evaluate all discrete regimen possibilities

findDose()

Find the dose required (quick and dirty, to be optimised)

findFirstCompatibleModel()

Find the first model in the TDMore set compatible with the specified covariates.

fitted(<tdmorefit>)

Get the predicted (fitted) data

flatten()

Flatten a treatment regimen

fluticasone_model

Default example model TODO: Better documentation required

formula(<tdmore>)

Get a formula that describes this model

formula(<tdmorefit>)

Get the model used to provide this fit

getLikelihoodFun()

Get the right likelihood function for the specified type.

ll()

Calculate the log likelihood as the sum of the population likelihood and the prediction likelihood.

logLik(<tdmorefit>)

Get the log-likelihood of the predicted values.

meropenem_1param_model

Default example model TODO: Better documentation required

meropenem_model

Default example model TODO: Better documentation required

meropenem_model_wt

Default example model TODO: Better documentation required

meropenem_omega0_model

Default example model TODO: Better documentation required

model.frame(<tdmore>)

Get the specified data values, with the upper and lower bounds provided by the residual error model

model.frame(<tdmorefit>)

Get the observed values used to provide this model fit.

pheno

Phenobarbitol dataset, as included in the NONMEM distribution.

pheno_nlmixr

NlmixrUI object describing Phenobarbitol 1-compartment model with IV administration and allometric scaling on weight

pk1cptivbolusVCL()

A tdmore model to predict concentration in a 1cpt PK model with bolus administration

pk1cptoralbolusVCL()

A tdmore model to predict concentration in a 1cpt PK model with bolus administration

plot(<tdmore>)

Plot a tdmore object (typical profile of the population and between subject variability).

plot(<tdmorefit>)

Plot a tdmorefit object.

plot(<tdmoreprofile>)

Plot a tdmoreprofile object.

plotpossibilities()

Plot the fitted prediction under all discrete regimen possibilities

pop_ll()

Calculate the population log likelihood.

possibilitygrid()

Calculate all possible regimen combinations, as rows in a data.frame

predict(<tdmore>)

Predict from a tdmore model

predict(<tdmorefit>)

Predict new data using the current model

predict(<tdmore_mixture>)

Predict from a TDMore mixture model. Default model will be used for predictions.

predict(<tdmore_set>)

Predict from a tdmore model set.

pred_ll()

Calculate the prediction log likelihood.

print(<recommendation>)

Print a recommendation object.

print(<tdmore>)

Print a tdmore object.

print(<tdmorefit>)

Print an EBE fit.

profile(<tdmorefit>)

Get an overview of the log-likelihood for varying parameter values. If arguments `fix` and `limits` are not set for a specific parameter, individual eta's will be generated to cover 95 percent of the population distribution.

residuals(<tdmore>)

Get the residual values of a predicted value vs the observed value This is based on the log-likelihood of the observed value in the residual error model

searchspace()

Define a blank search space

stat_predict()

Calculate predictions using the provided tdmore model. This is very similar to stat_function, but the calculated values are calculated using `predict.tdmorefit`.

summary(<recommendation>)

Summarize a recommendation object.

summary(<tdmore>)

Summarise a tdmore object.

summary(<tdmorefit>)

Summary of a tdmorefit object.

sunitinib_pkpd_model

Default example model TODO: Better documentation required

tdmore(<algebraic>)

Build a tdmore object based on an algebraic model

tdmore(<default>)

Default function, catching unsupported types of models

tdmore(<nlmixrFitCore>)

Create a TDM-capable model from an nlmixr result.

tdmore(<nlmixrUI>)

Create a TDM-capable model from an nlmixr UI object.

tdmore()

tdmore is a generic function to append TDM functionality to a pharmacometrics model.

tdmore(<RxODE>)

Create a TDM-capable model from an RxODE model

tdmorefit()

Create a tdmorefit object manually

tdmore_deSolve()

Create a TDM-capable model from a deSolve model

tdmore_mixture()

Create a TDMore mixture model.

tdmore_set()

Create a TDMore set. Note that the order of the given models matters. Order must be defined from the most restrictive model (with a high number of covariates) to the lowest restrictive model (with a low number of covariates). These models will be tried one by one from left to right with the 'observed' data. The first model matching the covariates from the 'observed' data will be used.

theopp

Theophylline dataset, as included in the NONMEM distribution.

theopp_nlmixr

NlmixrUI object describing theophylline 1-compartment model with oral absorption

transformRegimen()

Transform a specific treatment regimen using a modifier

two_error_models

Default example model TODO: Better documentation required

updateRegimen()

Update a regimen with the specified dose.

vcov(<tdmorefit>)

The variance-covariance matrix

vectorToDiagonalMatrix()

Convert a numeric vector/list into a diagonal matrix. If the vector/list is named, names will be used as the column and row names of the resulting diagonal matrix.

Dose recommendation

Define a target value to reach, and find the dose that will bring the patient to that target.

computeTmax()

Compute the TMax value based on the specified regimen and observed data.

findDose()

Find the dose required (quick and dirty, to be optimised)

coef(<recommendation>)

The obtained parameter values for a recommendation.

plotpossibilities()

Plot the fitted prediction under all discrete regimen possibilities

possibilitygrid()

Calculate all possible regimen combinations, as rows in a data.frame

searchspace()

Define a blank search space

transformRegimen()

Transform a specific treatment regimen using a modifier

updateRegimen()

Update a regimen with the specified dose.

discrete.searchspace()

Add discrete options to a search space

evaluate()

Evaluate all discrete regimen possibilities

flatten()

Flatten a treatment regimen

print(<recommendation>)

Print a recommendation object.

summary(<recommendation>)

Summarize a recommendation object.
